title: The Philosophy of Redemption
description: In his central work Die Philosophie der Erlösung (The Philosophy of Redemption or The Philosophy of Salvation[4]) – according to Theodor Lessing, "perhaps the most radical system of pessimism known to philosophical literature"[Note 1] – Mainländer proclaims that life is absolutely worthless, and that "the will, ignited by the knowledge that non-being is better than being, is the supreme principle of morality.
author: Philipp Mainländer
